climbs.name: (but they all don't care cause they have) "No Underwear"
climbs.fa: Zac Warren, Roy Suggett, and Pat Curry

content.description: A great chimney on good rock!  Half way up a rest is on soft rock that can send a few things down.  Belay to the side. Some cruxy chimney moves follow and lead to a good ledge where the face moves begin.  Small edges and erosion pockets get you through the crux of this route.
content.protection: Two #6s, one #1, slings for chalk stones, small to medium cams, tricams (red-black), two quick draws that protect the face moves and something to clip the bolts at the anchor shared with "The Hole In The Wall."
content.location: Just right of "A Hole In The Wall" in a shady alcove.

climbs.name: (a place in france where the) "Naked Ladies Dance"
climbs.fa: Zac Warren, Roy Suggett, Pat Curry, and Jim Mathews

content.description: This long line on great rock goes as a lie-back or straight in, up almost vertical rock.  There are a couple of rests but the crux is just not running out of steam!  This is so much fun it is a shame it is so far off... or not.
content.protection: One #1, three #3s, four #4s, two #5s, and two #6s along with a set of Tricams. On second thought, bring all the #4s you can gather!  This line sucks them up like no other! Something to clip the bolts at the top.
content.location: As of 3/30/13 first route on the Barricade Wall (Left to Right).

climbs.name: "A Hole In The Wall" (where the men can see it all)
climbs.fa: Pat Curry,  Roy Suggett, and Zac Warren

content.description: Much better than it looks, this line will fool you on how tricky it is!  The crux is a third of the way up where the crack narrows for about six feet. Very interesting moving past this!
content.protection: Three #00, and then doubles through #5s. A set of tricams for erosion pockets.  Something to clip the bolts at the top.
content.location: In a shady alcove just left of the chimney called "No Underwear."
